resources.string: "Okay. I'll notify you know when I've analyzed the audio."

Text to speech engines take up a lot of resource and consequently can take a while to initialize and be ready to speak. This is more common on higher quality engines, regardless of whether they are downloaded and installed on the device or not.

In the Superuser Settings, under Memory Usage, you can adjust how long the text to speech engine is bound to Saiy and kept in the memory. The longer allowed time, the less likely the initialization process will be required for subsequent commands

This additional memory usage should be negligible to the performance of any modern device. If Android needs the memory back, it will take it!

In the Saiy Settings, if you have selected to use the network synthesized voices (available via Google's text to speech engine), a delay can occur due to the speed of your network connection. If your mobile connectivity is a little hit and miss, disabling this feature unless you are connected to WiFi, could certainly helpâ€¦

Tap for settings. Tap and hold for Superuser Settings
